snippet: Workers at Seattle’s airport seek substantially higher hourly pay, and they deserve to get it.
abstract: Editorial welcomes popularity of ballot initiative, still being counted in SeaTac, Wash, that would raise minimum wage for workers at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport to $15 per hour; holds  sum is not as high as it first appears, and that raising minimum wage is a prime tool for combating income inequality.
lead_paragraph: Workers at Seattle’s airport seek substantially higher hourly pay, and they deserve to get it.
